title: The Confession Algorithm
outcome: A hidden BCI protocol activates, sending confessional messages written in Halden's voice to citizens and Council alike. As Halden's doubts and motives unfold, both population and leadership are forced to confront their reliance on system narratives versus true self-governance. The line between truth and manipulation blurs, stirring deep debate and division.

events.description: Council members receive the first of a series of anonymous confessional statements, apparently written by Halden, outlining his private fears and justifications for BCI's harshest policies.
Mysterious "Halden letters" begin to appear in public spaces, each recounting moments of regret and ethical struggle from Halden's perspective. Citizens gather to debate their meaning.

As more confessions are released citywide, trusted public figures host open forums, prompting widespread discussion on whether to restore any form of the BCI or abandon centralized compliance entirely.

A final confession surfaces: Halden admits he created an algorithmic loop in BCI to force society to eventually choose between submission and freedom. The city is thrust into a vote—keep a tamed BCI or embrace messy self-rule.
